org.macquarie.ticker
Class TickerExample

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      org.macquarie.ticker.TickerExample
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class TickerExample
extends javax.swing.JFrame

An example application which uses our stock ticker. We create a MarketFeed and a StockTicker widget object and set them both running in threads of their own. Notice that we use different thread creation methodologies in each case - as described in the week 8 notes.

Author:
Dominic Verity
See Also:
Serialized Form

mApplication

private static TickerExample mApplication

Constructor Detail

TickerExample

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] pArgs)
The main entry point to our application - simply creates the application object and sets it running. Notice that we must run the initialisation code for any GUI in the "Event Dispatch Thread" rather than in the "Main" thread, and to do that we use the SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Runnable) method - you'll find out more about this in week 9.

Parameters:
pArgs - array of command line arguments.

initApp

private void initApp()
Initialise our application, by setting up the GUI layout, packing its components, switching

Create the components for the GUI and lay them out in the application window.
